name: Terror From The Deep
description:
Breda University of Applied Sciences  School Project

You as the crew are escaping from a Research Station in the Antarctic via a submarine, but beware!

A Deep-sea monster is on board, and it will do whatever it can to bring your vessel down and kill you.

Use your tools to keep the U-Boat moving and use the light to your advantage in this first-person survival game.

After Playtesting, we would appreciate if you could click on this link and fill in the Playtesting Form: https://forms.gle/RnH14jgGwiXBvc6b7

Features:

  • Flashlight functionality
  • Monster movement and hatred of the light
  • Monster and character animations
  • Custom ambient sound and sound effects for walking and broken machines
  • Movement, including sprinting and crouching
  • Repairing systems mechanic
  • Monster AI that hunts the player
  • Sanity system partly implemented 
  • Illusions caused by low sanity are partly implemented
  • melee attack for the monster partly implemented
  • Timer
  • compressor and engine have custom sounds for working and broken
  • flashlight battery
  • dying
  • nameplates for rooms and to lead the way
  • settings menu with volume control and input remapping

Planned:

  • Several different Crew member models
  • First person animations and more 3rd person animations in planned
  • perfecting the sound effects already implemented
  • custom sounds implemented for the rest of the machines (so excluding the compressor and engine)
Controls

ASDW = Standard movement

Left Shift = Sprint

CTRL = Crouch

LMB  = Toggle flashlight

P = Open Menu Screen

E = Repair

***Known bugs***

- all machines make the same sound as the engine except for the compressor
